definition: to rest/to stop doing sth for a period of time/to cease/(imperative) don't

sentences.english: Choose your casual shoes based on what it means for you.
sentences.chinese: 選擇您的休閒鞋的基礎上這是什麼意思你。

sentences.english: If you're a big guy, your casual shoes will look best with a thicker sole.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是一個大個子，你的休閒鞋將最好的厚唯一。

sentences.english: If I owned only walking shoes, I wouldn’t be able to wear skirts or dresses.
sentences.chinese: 如果我只有休閒鞋，我就不能穿短裙或是連衣裙。

sentences.english: A pair of ankle-high boots in black or brown can substitute for the loafers.
sentences.chinese: 一雙黑色或棕色的靴子可以代替休閒鞋。

sentences.english: The classic dress shoes are lace up oxfords or shiny slip on loafers.
sentences.chinese: 傳統的正裝鞋可以選擇繫帶牛津鞋或者鋥亮的休閒鞋。

sentences.english: Don't get caught up in the cesspool of mediocrity when it comes to your choice of casual footwear.
sentences.chinese: 不要陷入平庸的糞坑中，當涉及到你選擇休閒鞋。

sentences.english: Major production company to develop high-grade sports shoes, casual shoes, hiking shoes.
sentences.chinese: 公司主要開發生產中高檔運動鞋，休閒鞋，登山鞋等。

sentences.english: We are specialized in producing all series of sport shoes, such as basketball shoes and recreational shoes.
sentences.chinese: 我們是專業生產的各系列運動鞋，如籃球鞋和休閒鞋。

sentences.english: Simplicity is the main principle of wintry leisure shoes.
sentences.chinese: 簡單是今冬休閒鞋的主要原則。

sentences.english: Casual footwear for the entire family.
Would you like to buy dress shoes, or casual shoes?
sentences.chinese: 您想要買正式着裝鞋還是休閒鞋呢？

definition: to take off costume and makeup/bottom garment (trousers etc)
